info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Schoharie, southeastern Herkimer and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jordanville to Canajoharie. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Canajoharie, Fort Plain, Sharon Springs, Ames, Palatine Bridge, Nelliston, Marshville, Leesville, Cook Corners, Beekman Corners, Buel, Hessville, Starkville, Sprakers, Engleville, Willse Four Corners, Ripple Corners, McKinley, Sprout Brook and Newville. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
